[teachers]  [appearing gentle and innocent],   [that is, by their contrived doctrine and self-focus].      [as false prophets].  [when I judge them],   [you are banished from My presence],  [disregarding My commands].â€™
When Jesus had finished [speaking] these words [on the mountain], the crowds were astonished  overwhelmed at His teaching;
for He was teaching them as one who had authority [to teach entirely of His own volition], and not as their scribes [who relied on others to confirm their authority].
